column4: hey guys.. im the developer of gnome-schedule, and right now im trying to help somebody set up cron and at
does anyone have know of a tutorial, howto for these things?
and how is the daemons started (note, im not using ubuntu myself - so im just gonna pass the info on)
are*
just the names of the init scripts for atd and crond would help
all the init scripts live in /etc/init.d, and are linked to from /etc/rc2.d/ (which is the default runlevel)
that includes crond and and atd.
thanks.. does he have to put the setuid bit on /usr/bin/crontab ? (or for at)
i have crontab with suid on mine, so i'm guessing that means yes. :)
ok, thanks :)
hm, actually, it seems to be sgid, and is owned by "root:crontab". to be precise.
yeah.. he sent me the output of ls -l, and it seems like its already been set
he probably just have to start the daemon - is it started by default?
whats the proper, user friendly, way to do that? system -> preferences -> services ?
depends on how he installed it. if he installed manually from source, then probably not started, has to start manually. if installed from the repos, it would start the daemon after installing.
why not just do a "ps ax |grep cron" and see if it's running. :)
he did, and it doesn't :) but just wondering how i can get him to activate it
hmm, proper user friendly way... probably "sudo invoke-rc.d crond start"
ok - i'll tell him that
ok :)
thanks!
no prob. :)
